Package: io.vertx.groovy.core

[Groovy] Class Vertx

    • io.vertx.groovy.core.Vertx
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      Measured

      @CompileStatic
class Vertx

      The control centre of the Vert.x Core API.

      You should normally only use a single instance of this class throughout your application. If you are running in the Vert.x container an instance will be provided to you.

      If you are using Vert.x embedded, you can create an instance using one of the static VertxFactory.newVertx methods.

      This class acts as a factory for TCP/SSL and HTTP/HTTPS servers and clients, SockJS servers, and provides an instance of the event bus, file system and shared data classes, as well as methods for setting and cancelling timers.

      Instances of this class are thread-safe.

      Authors:
      Tim Fox

        • Map<String, Map<String, Object>> metrics()

          Will return the metrics that correspond with this measured object.

          Returns:
          the map of metrics where the key is the name of the metric (excluding the base name) and the value is the json data representing that metric

        • TimeoutStream periodicStream(long delay)

          Returns a periodic timer as a read stream. The timer will be fired every delay milliseconds after the ReadStream.handler has been called.

          Returns:
          the periodic stream

        • void runOnContext(Handler<Void> action)

          Put the handler on the event queue for the current loop (or worker context) so it will be run asynchronously ASAP after this event has been processed

        • long setPeriodic(long delay, Handler<Long> handler)

          Set a periodic timer to fire every delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.

          Returns:
          the unique ID of the timer

        • long setTimer(long delay, Handler<Long> handler)

          Set a one-shot timer to fire after delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.

          Returns:
          the unique ID of the timer

        • SharedData sharedData()

          The shared data object

        • TimeoutStream timerStream(long delay)

          Returns a one-shot timer as a read stream. The timer will be fired after delay milliseconds after the ReadStream.handler has been called.

          Returns:
          the timer stream
